bugs.title: CVE-2023-47995 freeimage: Buffer Overflow vulnerability in FreeImage_AllocateBitmap [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-47995 freeimage: Buffer Overflow vulnerability in FreeImage_AllocateBitmap [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-47995 FreeImage: Buffer Overflow vulnerability in FreeImage_AllocateBitmap

long_desc.thetext:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in BitmapAccess.cpp::FreeImage_AllocateBitmap in FreeImage 3.18.0 allows attackers to cause a denial of service.

https://github.com/thelastede/FreeImage-cve-poc/tree/master/CVE-2023-47995

Created freeimage tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2257655]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257661]


Created mingw-freeimage tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257666]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2257652

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2257652,2257661

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2023-47997 freeimage: infinite loop exits in Load in PluginTIFF.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-47997 freeimage: infinite loop exits in Load in PluginTIFF.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-47997 FreeImage: infinite loop exits in Load in PluginTIFF.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
An issue discovered in BitmapAccess.cpp::FreeImage_AllocateBitmap in FreeImage 3.18.0 leads to an infinite loop and allows attackers to cause a denial of service.

https://github.com/thelastede/FreeImage-cve-poc/tree/master/CVE-2023-47997

Created freeimage tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2257660]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257665]


Created mingw-freeimage tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257670]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2257654

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2257654,2257665

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds

stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable

# Suggest that users restart after update
